title: Cloud Security
description: This workshop will provide participants with an understanding of cloud security principles, best practices, and strategies to protect cloud-based systems and data. The focus will be on securing cloud infrastructure, identifying vulnerabilities, and mitigating risks in cloud environments.
registration: Only college students are permitted to participate.
A valid college ID is mandatory.
Participants must wear the registration throughout the day.
Prior registration is mandatory to attend any event/workshops, either online or on-spot.
Re-entry is not allowed, and the fee paid for any event/workshops is non-refundable.
rules: Participants must bring their own laptops with necessary software and tools installed (e.g., cloud management tools, security software).
A basic understanding of cloud computing and security concepts is required to participate.
Active participation is expected during hands-on exercises and real-world case studies.
No use of mobile phones, external gadgets, or unauthorized resources during the session.
Disruptive behavior will result in disqualification from the workshop.
Participants should refrain from sharing or using unauthorized code during practical sessions.
Workshop materials and resources provided by the instructors should not be distributed or used for commercial purposes.
Participants will have the chance to ask questions, but must ensure it doesnâ€™t disrupt the flow of the workshop.
